TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SensorType extends System.Enum

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Hardware.SensorType Accelerometer = int32(1)

summary.para: A constant describing an accelerometer sensor type. See for more details.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Hardware.SensorType All = int32(-1)

summary.para: A constant describing all sensor types.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Hardware.SensorType AmbientTemperature = int32(13)

summary.para: A constant describing an ambient temperature sensor type

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Hardware.SensorType GameRotationVector = int32(15)

summary.para: Identical to except that it doesn't use the geomagnetic field. Therefore the Y axis doesn't point north, but instead to some other reference, that reference is allowed to drift by the same order of magnitude as the gyroscope drift around the Z axis.

In the ideal case, a phone rotated and returning to the same real-world orientation should report the same game rotation vector (without using the earth's geomagnetic field). However, the orientation may drift somewhat over time.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Hardware.SensorType GeomagneticRotationVector = int32(20)
.field public static literal valuetype Android.Hardware.SensorType Gravity = int32(9)

summary.para: A constant describing a gravity sensor type. See for more details.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Hardware.SensorType Gyroscope = int32(4)

summary.para: A constant describing a gyroscope sensor type

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Hardware.SensorType GyroscopeUncalibrated = int32(16)

summary.para: A constant describing a gyroscope uncalibrated sensor type. See for more details.
No gyro-drift compensation is performed. Factory calibration and temperature compensation is still applied to the rate of rotation (angular speeds).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Hardware.SensorType HeartRate = int32(21)

summary.para: A constant describing a linear acceleration sensor type. See for more details.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Hardware.SensorType MagneticField = int32(2)

summary.para: A constant describing a magnetic field sensor type. See for more details.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Hardware.SensorType MagneticFieldUncalibrated = int32(14)

summary.para: A constant describing a magnetic field uncalibrated sensor type. See for more details.

Similar to but the hard iron calibration (calibration due to distortions that arise from magnetized iron, steel or permanenet magnets on the device) is reported separately. No periodic calibration is performed (i.e. there are no discontinuities in the data stream while using this sensor). Assumptions that the magnetic field is due to the Earth's poles is avoided. Factory calibration and temperature compensation are still performed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Hardware.SensorType RotationVector = int32(11)

summary.para: A constant describing a rotation vector sensor type. See for more details.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Hardware.SensorType SignificantMotion = int32(17)

summary.para: A constant describing the significant motion trigger sensor. See for more details.

It triggers when an event occurs and then automatically disables itself. The sensor continues to operate while the device is asleep and will automatically wake the device to notify when significant motion is detected. The application does not need to hold any wake locks for this sensor to trigger.
